text: One of my favorite games. I don't care if Phil Fish made it, it's an incredible game that everyone needs to play. Stop being so anti this or anti that. Shut up and actually do something for once. "But Xbone is 900p and PS4 is 1080p." Genesis was way underpowered and it almost won. It was a great console because of games. I'm sure many games were made by assholes back then. So what?  Move on with your lives while enjoying their great games.
author: nintendonick

text: It's a shame the game has had zero replay value for me, because I loved the first playhrough for the obvious reasons. Ending was disappointing and lazy though.

text: Totally agree about the replay value, just hearing a single song makes me fly back into the atmosphere and experience; thinking maybe to play it again.Â  But it just wouldn't do it any justice on a replay, so I haven't at all yet...

text: Love me some Fez. I actively listen to the soundtrack now and then. Good for background music when studying or just wanting some noise.
author: boyblob

text: Disasterpeace gave this unique game an equally unique soundtrack, much like C418 did with Minecraft. Both games' use of reverb gives their soundtracks a very atmospheric feel. Playing this game with a theme like this one running in the background makes you want to stop and simply enjoy the moment.
